COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x102
STRING: I didn't know what business she had to attend to on
Thursday, but on both days after that, Lise came over to
my room.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x122
STRING: Her throat was still recovering, so she wasn't able to
sing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x138
STRING: In fact, since the day I chose her as my partner, we'd
hardly had any practice time together.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14e
STRING: That was thanks to a series of unfortunate events, from
her foot injury and the business she attended to over
New Year's, to her recent illness.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ae
STRING: But despite all that, Lise came over to my room and
listened to me play the Fortelle.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c4
STRING: Lise was supposed to be here this afternoon too.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1da
STRING: I was heating up some rusks in the oven for Lise, who
didn't eat much, or maybe she just didn't care about
food.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1f0
STRING: The rusks could be eaten normally, but baking made
them crisp and easier to eat.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x206
STRING: Discounting the times she'd been sick or injured, Lise
was actually very punctual, which was something I'd
learned recently.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x21c
STRING: [Chris] “Guess it's about time...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x24e
STRING: [Phorni] “Any time now.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x264
STRING: She wouldn't get to sing with Lise, but Phorni seemed
unusually excited.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x27a
STRING: I couldn't keep practicing Lise's song for the whole day,
and when I did play something else, that was Phorni's
turn to sing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x290
STRING: Phorni's voice was so amazing, it was too bad that only I
could hear it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2a6
STRING: If I could only let Lise hear it, I'm sure her singing would
get even better.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2cc
STRING: [Chris] “Coming!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x348
STRING: [Lise] “Good afternoon.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x35e
STRING: [Chris] “Hi, come on in.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x374
STRING: Leaving her rain-soaked umbrella by the door, Lise went
inside.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x380
STRING: She was definitely using the umbrella I'd bought for her,
because she was completely dry.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x396
STRING: After recovering from illness, it was wise to take such
precautions.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3be
STRING: [Lise] “Ah, something smells nice.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3d4
STRING: Lise whispered, looking in the direction of the kitchen.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3e0
STRING: Her voice seemed to be much better.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3ec
STRING: Would she be able to sing today, perhaps?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3f8
STRING: Or should we take things a bit more slowly?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x404
STRING: [Chris] “You didn't eat this morning, right?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x436
STRING: [Lise] “Right. But I'm not that hungry.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x44c
STRING: [Chris] “Still, you should have something, even a little. I'll
eat with you.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x488
STRING: [Lise] “...Okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x49e
STRING: I made Lise sit down, while I prepared a light lunch.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4aa
STRING: This was my first meal of the day too, so I could've had
something more substantial, but I wanted to have the
same amount as Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4ca
STRING: I added one part coffee, freshly brewed from the
espresso maker, to three parts warm milk to make a
delicious caffé latte.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4ea
STRING: I placed the baked rusks from the oven on a plate,
which I put on the desk.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x500
STRING: [Chris] “Well, dig in.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x532
STRING: [Lise] “Okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x564
STRING: When did it start, I wonder?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x572
STRING: When did we start having such natural conversations?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x588
STRING: The reserved Lise of before, who always spoke with a
slight stutter, was gone.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x59e
STRING: There was no doubt that I had something to do with it,
but I hadn't done anything significant.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5b4
STRING: At first, I'd simply improvised accompaniments on the
Fortelle for her singing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5ca
STRING: Lise always had a frightened look on her face, and she
was wary of this boy who'd suddenly appeared in her
sanctuary.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5e0
STRING: But after I saw how she truly enjoyed singing, I just
couldn't leave her alone.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5f6
STRING: The only thing I could do for her was to perform
ensembles with her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x60c
STRING: But Lise gradually opened up, and even started smiling.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x622
STRING: That made me so happy, and I waited at the Old Wing
so many times for her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x62e
STRING: Ever since then, I grew fonder and fonder of Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x646
STRING: Because of that, I hurt another girl's feelings.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x652
STRING: Someone important, someone who used to be my love.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x65e
STRING: But now, I thought everything had worked out fine.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x66a
STRING: That was the feeling I got when I looked at Lise smiling
in front of me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6ae
STRING: [Lise] “...What's the matter?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6c4
STRING: [Chris] “Sorry, just some random thoughts. Nothing
important.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6f6
STRING: [Lise] “Is that so? You had a peaceful look on your face.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x70c
STRING: [Chris] “...Really?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x73e
STRING: [Lise] “Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x754
STRING: Lise sounded happy, then she put a rusk in her mouth.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x760
STRING: I'd baked quite a lot, but Lise had been eating them, it
seemed, and the plate was nearly empty.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x780
STRING: [Chris] “Do you want some more?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7b2
STRING: [Lise] “No, it's okay. I'm full.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7c8
STRING: [Chris] “You should eat a little more.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7fa
STRING: [Lise] “...Ah.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x824
STRING: Lise blushed, as if she'd remembered something.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x830
STRING: I'd just remembered what happened that day too.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x844
STRING: [Lise] “A-Anyway, what are we doing today?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x85a
STRING: [Chris] “Well... How's your throat?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x88c
STRING: [Lise] “It feels a lot better, but...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8b6
STRING: As she spoke, she tried producing notes in the style of a
vocal exercise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8e8
STRING: [Lise] “＊cough＊”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8fe
STRING: [Chris] “...It's okay, don't force yourself. You'll never
recover properly if you strain yourself at this point.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x91e
STRING: Lise was already coughing and holding her throat as if
in pain.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x946
STRING: [Lise] “...If I just speak normally, I don't feel anything
though...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x966
STRING: [Chris] “Let's just relax today, okay? No need to rush
things.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x97c
STRING: The graduation recital was scheduled for the 20th of
this month.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x988
STRING: Even though we had barely two weeks left, the last time
I'd practiced with her, our music had been nearly
complete.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x99e
STRING: Ms. Cordell would probably disagree, but we didn't
have trouble with our breathing, which was most
important.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9b4
STRING: Lise had been singing that song all along, so her
technique was fine.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9ca
STRING: And even if I couldn't play in perfect sync with Lise's
voice, I'd played that song every day, so I had no
shortage of practice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9ea
STRING: As long as we were able to focus on practicing in the
final week, we'd probably be fine.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa00
STRING: That was how highly I rated her singing ability.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa28
STRING: [Lise] “About that... I thought about making scores,
actually.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa3e
STRING: [Chris] “Ah, right. Even if we don't need them, it'll look
bad if we went on stage without scores.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa66
STRING: [Lise] “Indeed. Moreover, I'd like to have a record of the
Fortelle arrangement you created for my song.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa86
STRING: [Chris] “...Well, I wouldn't call it an 'arrangement'
exactly...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xab8
STRING: [Lise] “Of course it is.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xae6
STRING: I think it's probably an incredible fit for this song.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xafc
STRING: [Chris] “Speaking of which, what about the original
song? I hadn't given it much thought until now, but I
probably should've followed that in the first place.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb26
STRING: [Chris] “Well, that's because the partner issue wasn't
relevant at the time. Anyway, if you have the original
song's score, copying that would be more accurate.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb6c
STRING: [Lise] “Actually, about that score, there isn't one now.
That's why I've been singing it from memory, or rather,
what's left of it in my memory.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb96
STRING: [Chris] “There's no score?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbc8
STRING: [Lise] “You see, I lost it a long time ago, for onel reason
or another.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc00
STRING: In fact, I just made up the lyrics later too.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc16
STRING: [Chris] “You hadn't memorized the lyrics either? That
means...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc48
STRING: [Lise] “It's a song that I used to hear all the time as a
child, that's how I learned to sing it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc68
STRING: [Chris] “I see... Do you remember the name of it, at
least? If it's in the school archives, we might be able to
find it. I'm free in the mornings anyway.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcae
STRING: [Lise] “No.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcdc
STRING: When I was young, I only ever saw one copy of the
score; it looked like someone wrote it out by hand. It's
not some famous tune, nothing like that.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcfc
STRING: [Chris] “I see. Well, there's nothing to be done then.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd2e
STRING: [Lise] “...And so, I was thinking of writing out a new
copy today, while listening to you play the Fortelle.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd4e
STRING: [Chris] “It's a nice song, though.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd80
STRING: [Lise] “...Thank you.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd96
STRING: [Chris] “Hmm?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdc8
STRING: [Lise] “N-Nothing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdf6
STRING: I'll get ready, then.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe02
STRING: Lise thanked me for some reason, as if I'd praised her
instead, and then she looked away bashfully as she
prepared.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe18
STRING: She placed a pen and brand new music sheets on the
desk, and looked at me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe40
STRING: [Lise] “Whenever you're ready. I'll transcribe as I listen.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe56
STRING: [Chris] “We did something like this during class, I think. I
was terrible at it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe92
STRING: [Lise] “Ha-ha... I don't dislike it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xea8
STRING: [Chris] “In that case, I'll play with a little extra effort.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xeda
STRING: [Lise] “Okay. Go ahead.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf22
STRING: [Phorni] “Do your best!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf54
STRING: This was the only song which Phorni couldn't sing along
to.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf60
STRING: She had never heard the vocal part before, and even I
couldn't really recall the lyrics at that point.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf76
STRING: From her usual spot by the window, Phorni serenely
listened to me play the Fortelle, her wings fluttering
gently.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf8e
STRING: I, on the other hand...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf9a
STRING: I'd say my playing so far had been carefree rather than
careless, but once I started thinking about being
transcribed, I got a little nervous.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfba
STRING: But then again, I'd had the fundamentals of it in my
head from the very beginning, so I wasn't short on
practice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfd0
STRING: My fingers moved by themselves, and without my
awareness, the song headed to its conclusion with
great certainty.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfe6
STRING: For a moment it seemed Lise was really going to sing.
Perhaps she wasn't aware of it either, but before any
note was produced, she'd started coughing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xffc
STRING: I was about to stop playing and ask if she was okay, but
Lise seemed to react quite strongly to that and stopped
me with one look.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1012
STRING: I went back to focusing on the song, while Lise returned
to the score in front of her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x108e
STRING: [Lise] “...That was great.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10a4
STRING: [Chris] “You did well too.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10ba
STRING: There were two scores, freshly transcribed, before Lise's
eyes.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10d0
STRING: Lise spent the rest of the afternoon on them, probably
because she was trying to faithfully reproduce the score
from memory.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10e6
STRING: Expressing in symbols the parts that she usually
ad-libbed was quite a taxing process.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1118
STRING: [Lise] “Done! This one's for you, Chris.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x112e
STRING: [Chris] “...Thanks.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1144
STRING: Lise's personality came out clearly in the score's
neatly-written letters and symbols.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x115a
STRING: Her upbringing was also evident at times like these.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x118c
STRING: [Lise] “And this one is for me.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11a2
STRING: Lise held the score close to her chest, almost embracing
it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11ae
STRING: That girlish gesture seemed very appropriate for her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11d6
STRING: [Lise] “Well, shall we call it a day?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11ec
STRING: [Chris] “Sure. If you stay out too late, they might find
out.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1228
STRING: [Lise] “...Indeed.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x123e
STRING: For the past two days, Lise had come over after school
ended, so she'd stayed a little later.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1254
STRING: But today was a day off, so we had been able to spend
more than enough time together.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x126a
STRING: All that was left was for her throat to get better.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1276
STRING: Even though almost everyone would disapprove of it,
our partnership was also going unexpectedly well.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x128c
STRING: We just had to nail the actual performance, and Lise
would win the recognition of her friends.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12a2
STRING: It was unlikely that she'd be able to express herself fully
otherwise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12b8
STRING: Looking at his attitude toward music, I was sure that
Grave would accept her too, as long as she produced
results.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12ce
STRING: With these somewhat optimistic thoughts, I decided to
focus for now on the upcoming recital.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12e4
STRING: [Chris] “Alright, let's head out before it gets dark.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1316
STRING: [Lise] “Okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1368
STRING: Sharing one umbrella, the two of us walked along
narrow streets.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1374
STRING: Walking Lise home was something I always did
whenever she came over to my place.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x138a
STRING: Nothing was more important to me right now than time
spent like this, being close to her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13a0
STRING: [Chris] “Are you getting rained on?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13da
STRING: [Lise] “Huh? No, I'm okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13f0
STRING: I noticed that Lise's shoulder was slightly exposed, so I
tilted the umbrella.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1406
STRING: She didn't have a fever, but her throat was still sore.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1412
STRING: I remembered how she'd coughed when she tried to
sing earlier, and I got a little worried.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1428
STRING: I was used to the rain, so it didn't matter to me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x143e
STRING: [Chris] “That's good.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1470
STRING: [Lise] “...Indeed.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1486
STRING: Lise moved over just the tiniest bit, closing the distance
between us.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x149c
STRING: We hadn't put into words yet the feelings we had for
each other.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14b2
STRING: Even so, Lise had to have noticed, and I was able to tell
how she felt too.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14c8
STRING: I also knew that it wasn't a misunderstanding.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14d4
STRING: In short, we just hadn't found the right time for it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14e0
STRING: I didn't have the right words either for the present
setting.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14ec
STRING: But the time would come, and the words would come
naturally, on the day of the graduation recital perhaps,
or even after that.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1502
STRING: Until then, the relationship we'd had so far would
suffice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x150e
STRING: I tilted the umbrella a little more toward Lise's side as
we continued walking to her home.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1574
STRING: [Lise] “Well then, thank you very much for walking me
home.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x158a
STRING: [Chris] “Don't mention it. Hope you get better soon.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15bc
STRING: [Lise] “Y-Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15d2
STRING: [Chris] “Ah... I didn't mean it that way. I just really want
you to feel better soon.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15f2
STRING: Lise had cast her eyes down, so I tried to cheer her up.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15fe
STRING: She regretted not being to practice, I could see it in her
expression.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1630
STRING: [Lise] “I-It's okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1646
STRING: [Chris] “Anyway, take care of yourself.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1678
STRING: [Lise] “...Yes, I will.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x168e
STRING: [Chris] “Well, here's your umbrella.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16a4
STRING: I made Lise take it, so that she wouldn't get wet when
she came over.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16c0
STRING: She seemed pleased to receive it, then she went inside.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16cc
STRING: I watched her go in, and then I headed home.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1708
STRING: When I got home, it was already dark outside.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1726
STRING: Before entering the room, I peeked inside the mailbox.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1732
STRING: There was nothing there, just a great big empty space.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1748
STRING: For some reason, I found it indescribably depressing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1754
STRING: I wasn't writing letters to Arie anymore, so that was
entirely expected.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x176a
STRING: There wasn't anything I could say to Arie, either.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1776
STRING: It was the path I'd chosen, but I couldn't stop this
feeling of desolation.
